text:
*[Bug 18671] Request to add fluids-synth*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18671>

Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED

--- Comment #1 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
The current version of fluidsynth has been added to the development version of
Rtools (to become Rtools44).

text:
*[Bug 18671] Request to add fluids-synth*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18671>

--- Comment #2 from Jeroen Ooms (<mailto:jeroen@berkeley.edu|jeroen@berkeley.edu>) ---
Thank you. The R package should automatically find it via pkgconfig once rtools
is updated on cran.

*[Bug 18669] librsvg version is very old*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18669>

Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED
         Resolution|---                         |WONTFIX

--- Comment #1 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
Rtools has the latest version of rsvg that doesn't need rust to compile. It
will not be upgraded before rust can be added reliably to Rtools, which is
unlikely to happen any soon on the main, Intel, platform. There is Rust GCC
project, to provide a rust front-end to GCC, but it is in an early stage of
development.

) ---
Rtools has the latest version of rsvg that doesn't need rust to compile. It
will not be upgraded before rust can be added reliably to Rtools, which is
unlikely to happen any soon on the main, Intel, platform. There is Rust GCC
project, to provide a rust front-end to GCC, but it is in an early stage of
development.
